citation.article-title: Cellulolytic and dextranolytic Gram-negative bacteria: revival of the genus Cellvibrio.

p.s: Description of Cellvibrio mixtus subsp. dextranolyticus subsp. nov.
Cellvibrio mixtus subsp. dextranolyticus (dex.trano.lyticus, dextran dextran a chemical; Gr.adj., lyticus dissolving; M.L.masc.adj., dextranolyticus dextran dissolving)
Description: Dextran is hydrolysed and acid is produced from fructose.

Although the cells are Gram-negative by staining techniques the Gram stain correlation tests (i.e. solubility in 3% KOH and 10% sodium lauryl sulphate and aminopeptidase activity) indicate that the cells are Gram-positive.
The moles % G + C of the type strain as determined by thermal denaturation is 55.2.
